body_html:
@colesbury - I have not written a test yet because we do not have NNPACK on our contbuild machines. I thought I had manually verified that the grad_bias was correct before, but I guess I omitted this. We would have to have some way of toggling NNPACK and comparing the results with non-NNPACK versions.

As far as I can tell, we don't have any Conv tests that actually have expected values for anything, we usually just compare different things (i.e. grouped convolution vs. two separate indivudual convolutions), or check for errors.

I thought I had manually verified that the grad_bias was correct before, but I guess I omitted this. We would have to have some way of toggling NNPACK and comparing the results with non-NNPACK versions.
As far as I can tell, we don't have any Conv tests that actually have expected values for anything, we usually just compare different things (i.e. grouped convolution vs. two separate indivudual convolutions), or check for errors.
body:
@colesbury - I have not written a test yet because we do not have `NNPACK` on our contbuild machines. I thought I had manually verified that the `grad_bias` was correct before, but I guess I omitted this. We would have to have some way of toggling NNPACK and comparing the results with non-NNPACK versions.

As far as I can tell, we don't have any `Conv` tests that actually have expected values for anything, we usually just compare different things (i.e. grouped convolution vs. two separate indivudual convolutions), or check for errors.
